Detailed Description

Mutual exclusion for thread synchronization.

Author:
Marc Parizeau, Laboratoire de vision et systèmes numériques, Université Laval

This class incapsulates a mutex with classic Mutex::lock, Mutex::unlock, and Mutex::tryLock methods. A thread that already has acquired the mutex should not lock it again because this could lead to a deadlock. A thread should only unlock a mutex that is has lock previously (the mutex is not recursive). Otherwise the behavior of the mutex is undetermined (OS specific).

This class should be compatible with any Unix that supports POSIX threads, as well as any version of Windows. It has been tested under Linux, MacOS X and Windows 2000/XP.

Definition at line 53 of file Mutex.hpp.

Member Function Documentation

void Threading::Mutex::lock ( void   )  const

Lock the mutex.

A thread should never lock a mutex twice consecutively (without calling method Mutex::unlock). Any error will raise a Threading::Exception.

Definition at line 87 of file Mutex.cpp.

00089     pthread_mutex_t* lMutex = (pthread_mutex_t*) mMutex;

00091     if(::WaitForSingleObject(*lMutex, INFINITE) != WAIT_OBJECT_0)
00092 #else
00093         if(::pthread_mutex_lock(lMutex) != 0) 
00094 #endif
00095             throw Exception(eWouldDeadLock, "Mutex::lock() can't lock!");

bool Threading::Mutex::tryLock ( void   )  const

Try to lock the mutex without blocking.

Return's true if successful; false otherwise.

Any error will raise a Threading::Exception.

void Threading::Mutex::unlock ( void   )  const

Unlock the mutex.

A thread should never unlock a mutex twice consecutively (without calling method Mutex::lock). Any error will raise a Threading::Exception.
